lines.text: Aren't you afraid? Aren't you afraid of dying?
The English have put a prize on your head.
[wakes up a man in the middle of the night]
I want you awake when you die.
[da silva pours some champagne into their glasses]
To slavery! The greatest misunderstanding in the history of mankind.
It was no misunderstanding. It was a crime...

[drinks the champagne, refills the glass]
Slavery is an element of the human heart.
The heat here is mean and inescapable. It courses through the bodies of people like a fever... and yet, my heart grows colder and colder.
I can not hear what you are saying, for the thunder that you are.

[storming into the royal hut]
The dead Kings have deposed you!
